title: Waistcoat Front, ca. 1725–35
medium:
Medium: silk, metal-wrapped threads with silk core
Technique: embroidery using satin stitch and couching in five different metallic yarns on silk plain weave patterned with supplementary warp floats
creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: Right front of gentleman's waistcoat embroidered in relief in gold and silver. Border pattern of foliage, flowers and pomegranates.

tombstone.epitaph:
Waistcoat Front, ca. 1725–35.
ca. 1725–35. Medium: silk, metal-wrapped threads with silk core
Technique: embroidery using satin stitch and couching in five different metallic yarns on silk plain weave patterned with supplementary warp floats. Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf. 1962-54-1-a.
